values:
Triniel kinda blew up on me, so I decided to relocate servers.

I'm currently on Ariel in the Elyos (Gwynn and Taysha) and in Yustiel for Asmodians (Wynne)

Let me know who I'm looking for if you log in?

Aion Open Beta Pictures! Meet the new Priest And just because I can, I made her a Chanter again AAAAHH! UGLY! Oh hey look, the ground's coming up awfully fast... DAEVA! Fashion shots: OMGWTFBBQ LADYBUG EARRING!!! And yes, you can ALSO see pendants: Just look at the shiny by my throat With Sanctum in the background Teleporting....the lazy person's way of traveling IN TOWN Outer port ...No, that's NOT the sky. That's Asmodae Motley crew... Rage + Mantras + Full DP bar = Shiny Locations: The floor design in front of the armor shop ("Ugh, did your mother pick those out?" um, why thank you Mr. Salesman) Eltnen - The floating fortress Asmodae - No, don't ask how I got there stupid teleporter practicing on me Oh, hey, look it's Elysea seen from Asmodae...I think I can see my house! Theobomos The END!
I'm on Triniel, Elyos. Char name Gwynn. I've been hanging out in channel 6 for now. COME FIND ME

and I made it past the first three hours of KH II. The remaining 27 hours it took to complete the game were cake after that.

Why couldn't we have just played Riku the entire way through though? He's way more fun.

Ok, so the final closed beta ended and I've been too lazy to update the pictures I took, so here they go. Some of them are a bit repeated (it's what happens when you ascend several characters) but they do give a very good idea of the game in general. Character screen! Yah...we were busy Ok, first things first: the scout ascended into an assassin! Variety of pics to follow: fighting the meany: Ascension! NOW, on to the mage, who ascended into a sorcerer: For the win! Wiiiiings! bow to me, plebe! New outfit! And new weapon battle formation (Verteron Citadel as background) Warrior, who ascended as a gladiator and I almost regret it, I think next one will be templar Not the only one getting wet...Akarios Village background, Poeta region Grr! Requisite badass pics from times past Flying pics from the Abyss Squaring off against ugly! MEANY!see, see! I told you I got dropped on my head And now, miscellaneous: Verteron Aetheric observatory: Healing spell New armor! Attention to detail: long hair gets braided when you put a hat on: More attention to detail: You can see earrings! I got a legion, too! Lookie cape! Blue armor! (courtesy of dye) Red Armor! (Verteron Citadel in background) Imma Frightcorn!!! and a dragon! And I think that's all. Goodbye!

closed beta six is done. So long. Bye bye.


Only a month to go for the release.

Ok, some of the last pics from the beta: Requisite shot of the character screen: Some armor pics of the Chanter. She got to level 15 after all was said and done And some battle actions: mantras, buffs and WINGS! And as a goodbye: Hearthing(warping home) =)

Warning - Giant wall of pictures under the cut My one and only attempt at an Asmodian lasted two levels: The scout got a little further: And now, in badass armor from before being dropped on her head: And a MAGE~ she lasted till level 7. Would have ascended if not for the end of the beta: Sleeping on a clouuuuud Battle formation! And now, a pretty scene or four: Soulbinding items! (in which an item is bound to you and cannot be sold to others) And manastone addition to items for enhancement: And a new outfit, kinda retro: Taxicab for the mage, too Requisite badass picture of the mage: OK, more pics of the Chanter in another post!

Huzzah! After a horrible day of trying to get the game installed, I managed to get into the beta and play around. Started with a warrior, but I gave up and moved to a priest. A priest, btw, who can wear chainmail, and smacks things around with glee. Ok, first of all meet the priest: And this is when she's pissed off: Oh, and I even got her a hat! So it seems that I was actually a Daeva to begin with, but I kind knocked myself unconscious falling from the stratosphere. On my head (don't ask). And barely missing a pool of burning lava. But I was badass before it happened: So I kinda had to work my way up the food chain again: I even had to take a cab! but I got my groove back by level 10, as well as my profession (Chanter) and the respect I apparently deserve: And MY WINGS! so it's only been one day, we'll see how/what I level/kill tomorrow =)
I'm officially a published author. Go me.

This is what happens when you clean up all your crap before you move into your new house. You find lists like the following: "Science can be many things, including a weapon with which to hit other scientists." -Anonymous, because I don't remember, but I presume it belonged to S. Shore. "Oh yeah, I'm in the Yellow Pages. Look under 'Bitch'." - "Where in the hell are you?" "Yes." - FF writer whose name I wouldn't be able to give you anymore. "Give me back my depression, dammit! Mine!" -C.B. Ah, the memories.

shame on you!

I am not quite sure if it is dead, alive or dying. It twitched a leg. I tossed the box.

ETA - It WAS alive. It jumped off the box and ran like hell. It was politely and repeatedly squashed by male co-worker. Yay boys!

Don't mind me


I just found the stupid song on itunes ^^

we have an ear infection, ladies and gents!


So I'm homebound for two days while shoving antibiotics down my gullet. Go me.

Mana potions are...interesting.


They're cammo green, have 6667% daily amount of B12 (the mind boggles) and taste like concentrated mountain dew.


And they seem to pack a rather large punch for such a tiny little thing.

http://www.thinkgeek.com/caffeine/drinks/a273/

Laringitis sucks.


It sucks so much it should have its own zip code of suckdom.


Day 3 with no voice. Good thing, too, cause I sound like a rusted, squeaky hinge when I DO get some voice back, but it only lasts for about about three words and then it's gone again.

Arrgh.

Dear. God. Greatest concert. EVER. The Drive Yeah, this one requires a spot for itself. So here we are, happily chugging along the interstate when suddenly my husband grimaces, tightens his hold on the steering wheel and announces we've just lost power steering and the engine is heating up. Enter 'oh shit' moment. I want to blame Jaydin, as I happened to be on the phone with him when this happened. We glide/pray our way into the parking lot of a Walmart only to realize that it is not open. Yay. So we're in between two states, with a broken car and no handy Walmart. After a slight foray under the car we realize that one of the serpentine belt pulleys has come loose and we barely managed to not loose it along the highway. More calls to Jaydin and some panicky 10 minutes of driving with no serpentine belt, we hobble into a repair shop that was miraculously open. By that same miracle (assuming the angels were bored) we find a part. Part repaired for a ridiculously low amount of money, we find ourselves happily on our way 1.5 hours later. Phew. For having lost part of the car, we sure got it easy. The Hotel Zip along to the hotel after getting lost, as usual *fist shake* Curse you, Chicago, and your silly, unmarked layouts. Lovely hotel, gigantic, fluffy bed, Cartoon Network. Room Service! Burgers big enough to have their own zip code (which, for what they charged us, I wasn't expecting any less). Indulgence in the form of a Chocolate Cinnamon Warmer (hot chocolate with Triple Sec and Cinnamon Schnapps...most accurate name ever written). Line forming outside the concert hall (which is right across the street, heh) we head out there. The Hall The Concert Hall is actually a very nice one, we made it there in time to get in line for some merchandise. Apparently our line was the plastic line, since people started falling out of it when they announced they took cash only. Again a spot of luck, we had just enough cash to get...well...everything. T-shirt, program, CD. Whee. Hoarding our newfound riches, we sneak around to our seat. First row balcony, straight in the middle. As we're running around, we see the cosplayers. A Red Mage/White Mage couple are posing for pictures. Awesome pimp hat, otherwise kinda bland costumes, but it was amusing. The only other cosplay was a young woman dressed as Edea (FFVIII). Amazing cosplay, she had a wonderful arrangement done with her hair. Which meant she did not sit down at any time when music was not being played, as she was being pestered for pictures. Heh. We felt for her. The Concert Oh. My. God. They have indeed learned from last time. I'll just recap a few: Liberi Fatali Well played, choir, well played. This time they smarted up and gave microphones to the choir. It was beautiful. Also, the video selections that went along with the music were much better this go. Don't be Afraid Linky If last concert the main impressions were surprised applause, this time it was laughter. The video began with some actual footage from FFVIII, annoying barking dog from Dollet included, and ran, with no music, till a random encounter. At which point the orchestra provided live music for this battle theme. Watching some actual battle footage (including Rinoa falling on her ass, which was greatly amusing) just seemed to make everything so much more fun. Memoro de la Stono - Distant Worlds Linky Beautiful. Simply beautiful. Wonderful transition from one to the next, amazing soloist for Distant Worlds. Much, much better than the original version of Distant Worlds that came out earlier. Absolutely amazing. Vamo' alla Flamenco Honestly? They have this one down so well it just gets better and better. The actual game scenes from when the song plays with the fight between Blank and Zidane didn't hurt much at all, either =) more than one of us were hitting our invisible controllers to the tune of "Press X" "Press O" To Zanarkand Linky ...it beats the piano version over and leaves it out by technical KO. Gorgeous arrangement for it, the orchestra was magnificent. The video that went along with it included cutscenes from FFX, using The Dance as the last cutscene to go along with the end of the song. I wish I could find this version somewhere. FFI -II -III Medley As always, a great arrangment. No surprises for the chocobo theme this time. Some actual 8-bit footage was amusing though. Amazing FFIII DS footage with beautifully rendered cutscenes. <3 Theme of Love While not one of my favorites (who wants soft and pretty when you can have, say One Winged Angel?), the video that went with this song was 3D rendered scenes that I had never seen before, I'm guessing from a newer version or a soon to come out version. The images alone made it very much worth it. Aerith's Theme Always a great one. And as always, no disappointment. Great scenes from FFVII to go with it, mostly 16-bit. I was kind of hoping for some AC imagery. Opening - Bombing Mission Linky That was awesome. The orchestra did such a great job, pulling an extremely powerful performance to some very true images. Basically got to see the start of FFVII all over again, with live music this time, which just makes it sound all the better. Love Grows Linky Best piano playing I have ever heard. Gorgeous. Mostly great amusement at some scenes from the ending of FFVIII, namely Seifer getting pissed off at his fishing pole and people getting kicked off docks. Play it to the end and you'll know what I'm talking about. Swing de Chocobo Linky ....GAH. A full song dedicated to chocobos! Dancing chocobos on screen! 8-bit, 16-bit, FFX, FFXI (running through Altepa, no less). Awesome, awesome arrangement. Funnest song in the entire concert. Opera: "Maria and Draco" Linky1 Linky2 Sweet Jesus that was good. The three opera singers were fantastic, the orchestra surprisingly good on such a long piece. The entire hall cracked up when after a rather intimidating "Then we duel!" from one of the singers he proceeded to close his book with the lyrics, square his shoulders and firmly face his 'opponent' singer. Talk about getting into character. Fantastic song, and great ending to the concert. We had the singers come back on stage for an even longer bow. They deserved it so much. Encore "One Winged Angel!" "Why do you have to be so predictable?" Hecklers ftw. It was Terra's Theme. Linky A magnificently played Terra's Theme that was just fantastic. The best part was, towards the end, seeing the actual ending scenes from FFVI, right along with the credits...for the concert. It made us all cheer. Ingenious, very ingenious. ........ ONE WINGED ANGEL The could not leave us without it. They really could not. Best. Absolutely BEST performance of One Winged Angel I have ever heard. Dear choir: thank you. They blasted through it with more lung power than I have given them credit for. The orchestra did as well, with an amount of volume that was enough to knock us all backwards. AC and FFVII images for video, including a nice fade from the AC Sephiroth to its 16-bit counterpart in the exact same scene. It was a mind-blowing performance which ended with the logo for the concert, Distant Worlds in a soft white and blue hue, in bright fiery flames. Best. Concert. Ever. Worth every penny.

Ok, so who still reads this?


And who would like to smack me for not updating?

"I've come to the conclusion that I can't speak Russian."
"That was Ukrainian, you're fine."

So....as promised.

The current medication I'm on is a synthetic derived from the saliva of the Gila Monster (translation: Big Lizard Spit).

It's injected twice a day ( >< ) and thankfully they gave me the Tiny Needle<small>TM</small>, 31G, 5/16" length. Nothing more intimidating than to hold that needle in one hand, and a chunk of your own stomach in the other and plunge it right in. I think I bored the nurse when they were teaching me by giving her the "you're expecting me to stick this in myself, areyououtofyourmind?" look. 

Besides that, I need to make mincemeat of my fingers twice a day to keep a record of my blood sugar readings. For the most part, the only one out of whack is my Fasting Blood Sugar (FBS from now on...on second thought, that reminds me of Fetal Bovine Serum, so maybe not). So far, lizard spit has brought that down by over 20 points in a week. We'll see how it goes from there.

Instead of calling this disease Diabetes Type II, they should call it Colander, XL size.


I've poked so many holes in myself in the last week it is not even funny. Granted, I'm getting to be an expert at stabbing myself with 5/16" needles in the stomach, I really am. I've also managed to catch the only 2 nerves in my stomach today, which doesn't make me any happier.

Thankfully, the lizard spit (I'll go into that in detail some other day) is moderating itself in how much it makes me feel like I would like to donate my stomach to science just to get rid of it. And I must admit it seems to be doing its job (albeit slowly, I foresee a dose increase). 


30 points from success. We'll see if I can pull it off.

So. Much. Love.


<3 De Niro so hard after that. Not really sure how they all managed to keep a straight face though 


Go see it if you can.

There's squirrel pron outside my window.


Stupid Love Tree.

Well, I just finished PoP: t2T. I picked up a used copy a few days ago (namely, Wednesday). Shame on me, I didn't remember which one came after The Sands of Time, apparently it was Warrior Within. Oops. I'm actually pretty fond of The Sands of Time. It's all the acrobatics of Tomb Raider to the power of 10 plus a sarcastic running commentary punctuated with "Stop talking to yourself!", which for some reason is extremely funny. It was kind of sweet to see they brought back the original characters (with weirder clothes and much, much dirtierdarker than before). T2T is a lot less campy than tSoT, but still kinda fun. I will complain, however, that some of the levels were apparently programed by the Sindicate of Retarded Miners of The Deadmines (BlizzardTM), while others were made by the Pwn Your Ass Recreational Group. I swear to God sometimes you just had to go for over 30 minutes of jumps, hops, scotches and daggers slams before reaching a stupid water fountain. And when you have to hang off a wall for 10 minutes just to figure out a timing, you need a water fountain. Of course, T2T wouldn't have been nearly so interesting without offering a running commentary while I played the Persian Ninja, and covering his face with his hands when I had to play the Dark Ninja. Oh, and laughing his ass off at me when I crashed my chariot 14 times within 3 minutes. I can't drive worth shit. Stupid horses. All in all, kinda fun. Love the ending, nice circular there. Still like tSoT much, much better though. Nothing quite beats the campy, although brownie points to the Dark Ninja for amusing corollaries, particularly when the girl was involved. "I'm expectantly waiting your answer to that one." Heh. PS - OMG the chicken. I wish I could rip the outtakes.

another experiment that doesn't want to work. Go figure.


I'm still the most apathetic thing to ever hit the face of the Earth, not really sure how long it's going to last. I've even lost the will to cook (and god knows I was looking forward to it). 


So....yeah.


PS - For Gnomeregan! (heh!)

To all who expected me to be:

- online

- responsive

this weekend, a heartfelt apology.

I officially feel like crap and have spent the better part of the weekend (Monday included) on the couch with (*gasp!*) several books. And tea. Lotsa tea.

I'm feeling no better and suspect it to be directly related to the ice storm that is going to fuck me over when I go to work tomorrow. I'll live, albeit whiny. Pray for <lj user="shanshsin">'s patience that he doesn't throw me out a window.

I'll catch you all when the couch looses its appeal (fat chance any time soon).

Have fun and don't do anything I wouldn't do.

~

and even more bandwidth. Be forewarned. The Empyreal paradox. ...and a close up. And one ugly ass butterfly (no respect for gods, no siree). My friends astound me at times. The robe in question. Meet VelvetZephyr. And again, fastest choco ever. And now, for something completely different: How Christmas came to Kamadan: Dear Mr. Grenth, I think your Grentchie hit the Spiked Eggnog a bit too hard Dwanya dropped by for a visit ...and she lent us a hand But there was also time to go adventuring into Fahranur, The First City

The sad part is, this fits. Except that I keep my arrogance at home most often. Or, I should say, the ACTUAL definition (and not the viperine version) fits like a glove.
Crackpot - INTJ
People hate you.

Paris Hilton hates Nicole Richie. Lex Luther hates Superman. Garfield hates Mondays.
But none these even rates against the insurmountable hate, people have for you.

I mean, you're pretty damn clever and you know it. You love to flaunt your potential. Heard the word "arrogant" lately? How about "jerk?" Or perhaps they only say that behind your back.

That's right. I know I can say this cause you're not going to cry. You're not exactly the most emotional person. You'd rather spend time with your theoretical questions and abstract theories than with other people.

Ever been kissed? Ever even been on a date? Trust me, your inflated ego is a complete turnoff with the opposite sex and I am telling you, you're not that great with relationships as it is. You're never going to be a dude or chick magnet, purely because you're more concerned with yourself than others. Meh. They all hate you already anyway.

How about this- "stubborn?" Hrm? Heard that lately? All those facts which don't fit your theories must just be wrong, right? I mean, really, the vast amounts of time you spend with your head in the clouds...you're just plain strange.

*****************

If you want to learn more about your personality type in a slightly less negative way, check out this.

*****************

From your long lost WHM! Just a quickie, in stolen format, to bring forth a pictorial record of some of the great moments of late. Note to self: don't dump fertilizer down the drain. These things grow like crazy. and if you didn't think I was good enough... ....1337! At least she's not calling me dead lady this time. Sushi party, oh yeah. 'ware of strange mithras around fishing areas. Dagger. On. Crack. Nuff said. Wish I could put them outside my mog house instead of in ; ; Especially this one. Noobism (name witheld to protect the Noob) Andi-ism (name not witheld, cause it's just Andi) VCS Blue Plaque recognizing my uber chocobo pimping skills. Boo. =)

My god, what a halloween.

Lets start off with the horrifying fact that my esteemed husband brought back a lovely present from Chicago: the flu.

Lets continue with the fact that he donated this lovely present to me.

Lets finish up by saying I am at work.


...yeah. Lovely.  

So if I'm not dead by the end of the day, it'll be a miracle. I'll take comments, requests, and tylenol from you guys. Tea, too.

When you overextend your knee to avoid smacking into a chair and it starts to throb.

It's very bad when it throbs through the night and you wake up with a bruise that surrounds your kneecap.

I think me and my knee capsule are going to have words.

You may have all noticed I've been scarce lately.

No, I'm not in jail.


I actually have a job. Been at it for 2 weeks now. It's going pretty good, but I am working pretty hard, so I rarely have the disposition to do anything other than dinner and sprawl when I get home.

If anything momentuous happens, I'll fax ya'll.
What I had to begin with: What he became:

Chicken Florentine, version moi


- Spinach (you should know how much you/others will eat)
- Garlic
- Oil
- Chicken breasts (deboned, amount as needed)
- Bacon
- Butter
- Milk
- Flour
- A big pan for the spinach
- 2 regular sized skillets
- 8x8 or 9x12 glass pan (based on the mount of spinach and chicken above)


* Boil the spinach. If you can't even boil spinach, get out of the kitchen now.
* While the spinach boils, slice garlic in relatively thick slices (at will, I used 3 regular sized ones) and brown slowly in a skillet with some oil (about enough to almost cover the bottom of the skillet).
* Drain spinach well. Dump into garlic oil. Jump back. I guarantee oil will spit at you when the water in the spinach hits it. Sautee at low heat for a few minute till the spinach is well covered in tasty garlic oil. Add salt if you feel the urge for it.
* Use the spinach to line the bottom of the glass pan. Reserve.
* Pan fry the chicken in another skillet (I warned you) till it's nice and golden on both sides. Lay it atop the spinach. Keep reserving it.
* Chop bacon into as big pieces are you're comfortable with. Toss it in the skillet you used to fry the chicken and fry it till it's soft.
* Add 1-2 teaspoons of butter to the skillet with the bacon (depending on how much gravy you're making). Allow it to melt and mix with the bacon fat and the bacon itself.
* Add milk (calculate how much gravy you're making, then add extra, about 1-2 cups). Mix slowly with the fat/butter/bacon. Keep the heat up on the pan around medium low and add salt and pepper to taste.
* Add flour slowly and mix well and constantly. Flour added at will, usually 2-3 teaspoons per 1.5 cups of milk. If your gravy is runny, add more flour, if it's too thick, add more milk. 
* When your gravy is at the right density, use it to cover the chicken and the bed of spinach. Cover evenly.
* Throw the pan with the spinach, chicken and gravy in the oven. I do 20min at 300F (not preheating oven).
* Take pan out. Serve. Make sure to not burn your tongue.

Ingredients:

Thick mashed potatoes (as many as you want, instant potatoes are fine)
2 eggs
Bacon (little pieces, fried)
Flour
Patience
Close by water supply


- Mix the mashed potatoes with 1 egg and the bacon. Mix well till smooth.

- Beat one of the eggs in another container.

- Dip your hands in flour. Pinch off some of the mashed potato mixture and roll it in your hand. Roll the little ball into the egg (it'll try to dissolve, don't let it), then roll it well in flour till it's well covered.

- Drop flour'd-egg'd-flour'd ball of potatos into a frying pan with about 1 inch of hot oil. Fry till golden on all sides. Set to drain on a paper towel.

Repeat till you're done with the mashed potatoes or you can't handle having crud on your hands anymore and can no longer see your counter over a layer of flour.

Serve with hot tomato sauce or ketchup at will. Add teeny bit of paprika to tomato sauce for better results.

If you felt the urge to cook while nauseous, like me, this would now be the time to die.

No, not the vegetable

<lj-cut text="the short one">

The great taru Cornnholio, who dragged himself to the Temple of Massive Ugh, opened doors for me like a loyal servant, and wiped the Temple Guardian like a tornado.

Of course, he also had to raise my dead ass when I scampered near the Temple Guardian and it smacked me, which made all the tonberries perk up and notice me. Mmm...adventurer under level 71...EAT IT!

Yah, that ended great. Especially with the Manipulator around ><

But the coffer was found. And the evoker's doublet was obtained. Hurray.


Special mention to Hell who dragged ME out in the first place, but someone had already snagged the coffer ; ;


Second special mention to Bosco who killed the Guardian over and over for a key so I could pop the coffer in the pantry later that night and get a map.


Yay.

</lj-cut>

For your favorite whitemage is BACK! Ok, so I'm not back, really. I'm just going to introduce you to a new part of my ever tightening schedule. It would seem like the VCS (VanaDiel Chocobo Society) is having problems with their own birds, so what better way to fix their problems than to ditch the birds onto someone else! That's right, adventurers are now allowed to raise their own chocobos, granted that they care for them. So I decided to give it a go and picked out a faintly warm choco egg and personally took it to the South Sandy stables. Guh, it took so long for it to hatch. But it did! And now I have a lovely male chicobo! See? Oh, and chicobo is what we are all calling the baby chocobos. They're too cute for anything else ^^. I named him AlphaGhost, just cause. He seemed to like it, see? And he is so cute it's not fair: So far he eats a few greens and some pastes. He started making a fuss at night, but I think we have that fixed. It was a bit of a scare, as he was asleep for much longer than we had intended him to be >< But he's awake now and behaving like he should. I'm even allowed to take him on walks My poor Buttwiggler had an upset stomach this morning though. Good thing I grew up some tokopekko grasses myself should the case arised. He should be feeling well shortly. Also, for shits and giggles, this should indicate how our adventures in the land of Dynamis are going: Narrowly indeed.
